recovered by the qNGD algorithm code. The corresponding 2D
cross-section images match each other better for the value of
0.5. Generally, this indicates that the 3D func-
recovery data are much better in the nearer vicinity, Z
approach has been developed that describes the X-ray diffraction propagation
in the vicinity of the point defect core in a crystal. To solve the inverse XRDT problem the iterative SA and qNGD
In the case of the Coulomb-type point defect the recovery of the 3D displacement-field function
been obtained. With certain limitations on a class of the searched functions
lytical and numerical forms, the iterative SA and qNGD algorithm codes
work well even for the one XRDT
At this point, it should be noted once more that the present
XRDT problem even if alternative algorithm codes have to be applied. On the other hand, a convergence of the
optimization procedure for the target function based on the SA and qNGD algorithm codes might be improved
by exploiting a number of the true XRDT 2D projections and, besides, some modifications of the SA and qNGD
. The question of whether the elaborated theoretical approach overall is effective or whether
it should be given up in favor of other approaches, which should be applied instead, remains a good topic for
1. Indenbom, V. L. & Chukhovskii, F. N. The problem of image formation in X-ray optics.
2. Epelboin, Y. Simulation des trajets des champs d’ondes dans un cristal contenant une dislocation.
4. Smirnova, I. A., Suvorov, E. V. & Shulakov, E. V. Formation of the image of an edge dislocation in an absorbing crystal.
5. Shul’pina, I. L. & Prokhorov, I. A. X-ray diffraction topography for materials science.
Dynamical Scattering of X-Rays in Crystals
7. Benediktovitch, A., Feranchuk, I. & Ulyanenkov, A.
Theoretical Concepts of X-ray Nanoscale Analysis
8. Takagi, S. Dynamical theory of diffraction applicable to crystals with any kind of small distortion.
9. Taupin, D. Théorie dynamique de la diffraction des rayons X par les cristaux déformés.
10. Besedin, I. S., Chukhovskii, F. N. & Asadchikov, V. E. Study of the diffraction contrast of dislocations in X-ray topo-tomography: A
. Three-dimensional imaging of crystal defects by ‘topo-tomography’.
. Determination of the three-dimensional structure of dislocations in silicon by synchrotron white X-ray topography
. Study of the internal structure of lithium fluoride single crystal by laboratory X-ray topo-tomography.
14. Zolotov, D. A., Buzmakov, A. V., Elfimov, D. A., Asadchikov, V. E. & Chukhovskii, F. N. The possibility of identifying the spatial
location of single dislocations by topo-tomography on laboratory setups.
Computed Tomography: Fundamentals, Technique, and Image Quality in Clinical Applications
16. Kirkpatrick, S., Gelatt, C. D. & Vecci, M. P. Optimization by Simulated Annealing.
Target function CP Target function CP
Initial and final recovery data of the 3D displacement-field function by the qNGD and SA algorithms.
The 3D displacement-field function is determined in the numerical form.
